column4: hey, I'm having problems with a REALLY old computer, an old version of Ubuntu and partitions: can anyone help?
I'm having problems with a REALLY old computer, an old version of Ubuntu and partitions: can anyone help?
well, I was stupid enough to not create partitions when I was installing, and I'm having problems creating one now
although, there may be a problem considering the drive is only about 8GB in size...
although any kind of use on the drive would be good
I mean, use it for space for Windows... long story
the thing is, I'm using Ubuntu 5.06, so I don't have the GNOME partition programme that the later versions have and the help web pages recommend I use
you can use parted from terminalm, but not on a mounted partition
have you tried the gparted livecd
have you tried installing it using apt or synaptic
look in the menu or type sudo gparted
to see if it's installed type which gparted in terminal
